title: Two rocks thrown off a cliff

content.question: Two rocks are thrown simultaneously from a height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> above the ground, as shown. Rock <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and is thrown horizontally with a speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Rock <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has a mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> and is thrown with the same speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> above the horizontal. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: Rock <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> hits the ground with a greater speed than Rock <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

content.answer: Rock <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and Rock <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> hit the ground with the same speed.
